title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: Ooh, now steady on! Ice Cream Cones and Deep-Fried Ravioli you can have, but Fish and Chips were popular in Britain during the 19th Century!
author: Hugh Farey

title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: I would like to eat Fish and Chips prepared and cooked by Hugh Farey. I’m pretty sure that they would be delicious.
author: PHPL

title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: Greasy Fish & Chips may have been popular in Britain in the 19th century but were actually perfected in Australia and New Zealand by Croatian and Greek  chefs.  The oil must be deep, hot (not smoky) and vegetable (not animal).  There are still a few Greek & Croatian takeaways in Wellington, but most have now been taken over by Chinese chefs.  My wife and I have excellently cooked crumbed cod, chips, with seafood oyster sauce once a week, an ideal combination.  An annual competition is held for the best served Fish and Chips among restaurateurs of the genre throughout New Zealand.
author: daveb of wellington nz

title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: I am a proud kiwi but have to confess that the best fish and chips I have had in recent memory was Golden Union in London last year
author: Thomas

title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: Dave …  always some strange remarks regarding the British …
author: PHPL

title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: I have forbears from Britain (arrived ~1850), from Ireland via Australia, from Jersey,also from Alsace-Lorraine, from Hesse-Nassau, and one British settler took a Ngapuhi lady to wife.  But we still know how to enjoy Fish & Chips! Future NZ will see a lot more of Asian descent.  My grand-son is fluent in Mandarin, his mother’s tongue. I have nephews who are Ngati-Porou.  It’s a changing world!
author: daveb of wellington nz

title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: We’re planning for the after-conference online discussion to be open to everyone, not just attendees and we certainly hope that most, if not all of the authors will take part.
author: Joe Marino

title: Will the English Show Up in St. Louis?
post: The English learnt to appreciate cod like the Portuguese and the Irish brought the potatoes.
author: Louis
